blog.name: alamutjones
blog.title: full of sound and fury
blog.description: A tale told by an idiot, signifying nothing

title: Thoughts About Bran Stark
body:
So, I’ve been thinking, and I have Thoughts About Bran Stark. More specifically, I have thoughts about Bran’s injury. I’m not an expert or anything, but…


In some ways, it seems like Bran Stark might be the luckiest cripple in Westeros. Based purely on what we see, the level of function he gets to keep after being pushed out of a window is really, REALLY high. Abnormally high.


He’s got full and unrestricted control of his upper body (including fine motor stuff with his fingers, which sometimes deteriorates even if it’s not totally lost) and even potentially some of the lower - he can’t feel or control his thighs or anything lower than that, but he seems able to use his hips at least a little bit. Not all paraplegics have that, since the level of control you get to keep depends on exactly where your injury is and exactly what kind of damage was done in that spot.


He’s had no mention of pressure sores or of circulation issues. This is huge. Circulation is an almost universal issue for people with limited mobility, including me and every wheelchair user I’ve ever met, but Bran doesn’t have a hint of it. We’d KNOW if he did, because cold makes circulation issues much worse and he’s been north of the Wall for sodding ages. If there was any character who should have serious issues in those conditions, it’s Bran, but Bran’s fine and somehow it’s Jojen Reed who falls apart.


He SEEMS to have surprisingly good bladder and bowel control. Again, this varies depending on where the injury is and what kind of damage was done…but there’s no mention of it, which sticks out a bit considering how happy GRRM is writing characters (even very young ones) being helplessly and gratuitously biological.


Every flip of the coin after his injury seems to have gone Bran’s way. Every single one. As I said, I’m just a layman…but he seems to have been freakishly lucky.


Is this just me?


Thoughts? Anyone? @nobodysuspectsthebutterfly, @racefortheironthrone, @dknc3? @joannalannister? @cynicalclassicist?

tags: a song of ice and fire

summary: Re Sansa ships, I shipped Jonsa before S6 due to stuff in the books but never thought it would happen, I thought Sansa/Edric...
question: Re Sansa ships, I shipped Jonsa before S6 due to stuff in the books but never thought it would happen, I thought Sansa/Edric could happen. Since Sansa&Jon reunited on the show I'm convinced Jonsa will happen in some form, I still expect Jon to die though. Sandry is a long shot but you never know because I think there will need to be new alliances between the kingdoms & marriage is the obvious way to do that. With few main characters likely to survive what marriages do you think could happen?
answer:
the problem with sansa/edric endgame is that house dayne is a minor house. unless sansa met him and fell in love very quickly in the books, i don’t see her marrying him esp when her marriage could bring kingdoms together since she has ties to 3 kingdoms. it’s still possible, after all he is strong, brave and gentle. 

book and show jonsa metas have swayed me a lot. it went from a crackship to something that could possibly be endgame. after all why mention sansa in the same breath as jon and dany? sansa can’t be the only person who disagrees with jon’s choice to bend the knee.

it’s hard because the show’s scope is pretty small. they don’t care about so many important houses. i doubt tristane will die in the books. if he had lived in the show, i would have said sansa x tristane is a possibility. tyrion’s dead. jon’s survival is dubious. euron is gone definitely and so are cersei and jaime. that leaves theon, one of the northern lords and one of the vale lords. all three are disqualified because theon has been castrated (the show treats it like a joke, like he’s less of a man. i doubt they’ll pair him with one of the main women). the only prominent vale lord is lord royce who is married. the northern lords we see are married too. that leaves a maybe alive jon.

as for arya, maybe gendry. then again d&d made the weird choice to have him not mention her once with jon. i mean sandor did. who knows? bran might marry meera or (weird i know) lyanna mormont or they’ll write him as the three eyed raven till the end because disabled people don’t deserve happy endings. if missandei survives, i think greyworm will die.

that’s it for the characters i know for sure are surviving. the rest are minor characters who don’t have romantic scenes.

blog.name: too-much-jonerys
blog.title: Jonerys Side Blog
blog.description:
Main Blog: lareinadecorazones.tumblr.com

Ao3: ReinaWritesStuff

CURRENTLY A GAME OF THRONES SEASON 8 NEGATIVITY BLOG. This is my Jonerys side blog, so my shipping fuckery doesn't disrupt my non-shipper/GoT followers because Jonerys is my life force now. I want to post and reblog in peace. NOTE: This blog is Gendarya, Team Dragonstone-friendly. This blog is NOT J*nsa-friendly or supportive of Jon or Dany's past romantic pairings. I don't actively hate on them on here in public. But, I will not post anything about them either.

summary:
Howling ghosts they reappear 
In mountains that are stacked with fear.
But, you're a king, and I'm a lionheart.
****
And, as the...
body:
Howling ghosts they reappear

In mountains that are stacked with fear.

But, you’re a king, and I’m a lionheart.

****

And, as the world comes to an end,

I’ll be here to hold your hand.

Cause you’re my king, and I’m your lionheart.

“King and Lionheart”- Of Monsters and Men


Have this shitty edit to commemorate the siblings bond that D&D can pry from my cold, dead fingers. In this house, the Starklings love and support each other and this song is them.

summary: A witch predicted the prince that was promised will be from Aerys' and Rhaella's bloodline, tho.

summary: The same way he gave Arya the dagger that started it all, the one that she used against Littlefinger on his trial, he might have...
body:
GoT theory (spoilers) : Bran Stark saved Meera’s life

The same way he gave Arya the dagger that started it all, the one that she used against Littlefinger on his trial, he might have saved Meera’s life, by broking her heart in season 7. After that, she took the decision of leaving Winterfell and Bran behind, returning to Greywater Watch. If Bran wouldn’t have been so cold, she might have had doubts about her choice.

JS.

caption:
Happy Halloween from the Starks! Featuring:

Robb as Captain America

Jon as a very low effort Tony Stark (hey, he wanted to be a Stark for once…)

Sansa as Scarlet Witch

Arya as Black Widow

Bran as Hawkeye

and Rickon as Thor
